definition: to go and take an imperial examination
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to beat/to hit/variant of 考[kao3]/to inspect/to test/to take an exam
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father

sentences.english: One scholar third go to the capital sitting the imperial examinations, and live in a regular live stores.
sentences.chinese: 有位秀才第三次进京赶考，住在一个经常住的店里。

sentences.english: Have place Xiucai third time to go to the capital rushing firmly having a test in, within a store who often lives.
sentences.chinese: 有位秀才第三次进京赶考，住在一个经常住的店里。

sentences.english: I remember when Mr. PU have a lot of beard, and is also busy to the exam.
sentences.chinese: 想当年蒲松龄先生胡子都一大把了，还忙着去赶考。

definition: to go and sit an examination
to take an exam
the triennial provincial imperial exam during the Ming and Qing
autumn exam (triennial provincial exam during Ming and Qing)
to pass an exam
to win top marks in the imperial examinations
a person who has passed the county level imperial exam (historical)/scholar/skillful writer/fine talent
metropolitan civil service examination (held triennially in spring in imperial times)/Crown Prince's chambers/by extension, the Crown Prince
to twine/to coil
money for a voyage/travel expenses
autumn exam (triennial provincial exam during Ming and Qing)
graduate/successful candidate in the imperial provincial examination
imperial examination
imperial examinations (in former times)
prefectural exam, the 2nd of the three entry-level exams in the imperial examination system of Ming and Qing dynasties
to enter the capital/to go to Beijing
successful candidate in the highest imperial civil service examination/palace graduate
